The Worthful Blog

Discussions of mental health, recovery, feelings, healing and learning to feel worthful.

Worthful - January 06, 2016
Being worthful means being full of worth. It's a way to learn how to respect yourself, whether that's by respecting your feelings, your needs, your desires, or who you are as a person. It wasn't something I felt before.
Tags: worthful, healing, excercise, rumination, self-talk, negative thoughts, emotions

The Criticizer, the Criticized and the Observer - December 22, 2015
This exercise gives some insight into the things we're telling ourselves, and help recognizing how we berate ourselves.
Tags: healing, excercise, rumination, self-talk, negative thoughts, emotions

Resources for Adult Children of a BPD Parent - December 21, 2015
A collection of resources I've found useful as someone with a parent with Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD).
Tags: bpd, resources, adult children, reading, articles, books, healing
